<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(21)&nbsp;E-Commerce Agreement  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June&nbsp;2001 and July&nbsp;2001, the former Gart Sports Company and former Sports Authority,&nbsp;Inc., respectively, entered into separate license and
e-commerce agreements with GSI, which expire on December&nbsp;31, 2011 and November&nbsp;8, 2019, respectively. Under the terms of the agreements, GSI developed and is currently operating four
online sporting goods stores at www.thesportsauthority.com, www.gartsports.com, www.sportmart.com, and www.oshmans.com. Under these agreements, GSI owns certain content and technology related to the
websites, purchases and owns the merchandise sold on the websites, and hosts, maintains, fulfills orders and furnishes all other "back-end" operations required to operate the websites. GSI
receives all revenue generated from the websites and pays the Company a royalty based on a certain percent of sales from these sites. In connection with the e-commerce agreements, GSI
granted Gart Sports a warrant to purchase 60,000 shares of common stock of GSI. A similar warrant for 30,000 GSI shares was acquired from Oshman's at the time of the acquisition. The Company sold
60,000 of these warrants in October&nbsp;2001, and recognized a gain of $195,000. The remaining warrant to purchase 30,000 shares was exercised on November&nbsp;2, 2001, and the shares that were
acquired upon exercise of the warrant were classified as available-for-sale marketable equity securities and were sold in September&nbsp;2003 for a realized gain of $100,000. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>(22)&nbsp;Stock Offering  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On May&nbsp;29, 2002, the Company completed a stock offering for 3.5&nbsp;million shares of common stock. This offering resulted in net proceeds of
approximately $52&nbsp;million from the sale of 1.75&nbsp;million new shares by the Company. The Company used the net proceeds to repay certain borrowings under the revolving line of credit
agreement with CIT Group/Business Credit,&nbsp;Inc. The balance of the shares was sold by selling stockholders, including Green Equity Investors, L.P. The Company did not receive any proceeds from
the sale of shares by selling stockholders. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>F-29</FONT></P>

August&nbsp;4, 2003 merger date, Oshman's results since the June&nbsp;7, 2001 acquisition date, and non-recurring merger integration costs. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="120">
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>During
the fourth quarter of 2003, the Company recorded vendor incentives, pursuant to vendor agreements and arising as a result of the TSA merger, resulting in an increase of gross
profit of $4.3&nbsp;million.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>During
the fourth quarter of 2003, the Company recorded merger integration costs, net of tax, of $13.7&nbsp;million related to the TSA merger.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>During
the fourth quarter of 2002, the Company recorded a reduction of its required LIFO inventory reserve, increasing the Company's gross profit by $1.5&nbsp;million. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ja1607_power_of_attorney"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ja1607_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that the undersigned officers or directors of the Registrant, by virtue of their signatures to this report, appearing below,
hereby constitute and appoint John Douglas Morton and Thomas T. Hendrickson, or any one of them, with full power of substitution, as attorneys-in-fact in their names, places
and stead to execute any and all amendments to this report in the capacities set forth opposite their names and hereby ratify all that said attorneys-in-fact do by virtue
hereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, this report has been signed below by the following persons on behalf of the Registrant and in the capacities
indicated on April&nbsp;14, 2004. </FONT></P>

10.25</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="88%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2003 Executive Incentive Plan of the former Sports Authority, Inc., effective as of February&nbsp;2, 2003.*</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
10.26</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="88%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Registrant's 2003 Performance Bonus Plan (attached as Annex&nbsp;G to the joint proxy statement/prospectus contained in Registrant's Form&nbsp;S-4 (File No.&nbsp;333-104321) as amended or supplemented, filed with the Commission on June&nbsp;20,
2003).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
10.27</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="88%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2000 Stock Option and Stock Award Plan, as amended (incorporated by reference to Exhibit&nbsp;A to TSA Stores,&nbsp;Inc.'s (formerly known as The Sports Authority,&nbsp;Inc.) Proxy Statement (File No.&nbsp;001-13426) filed with the Commission on
April&nbsp;26, 2002).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>

2000).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>

2003).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">

</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">

Amended and Restated Joint Venture Agreement, dated as of March&nbsp;12,1999 between TSA Stores,&nbsp;Inc. and AEON Co.&nbsp;Ltd. (incorporated by reference to Exhibit&nbsp;10.19 to TSA Stores,&nbsp;Inc.'s (formerly known as The Sports Authority,
&nbsp;Inc.) Form&nbsp;10-K (File No.&nbsp;001-13426) filed with the Commission on April&nbsp;23, 1999).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>

&nbsp;Inc.) Form&nbsp;10-K (File No.&nbsp;001-13426) filed with the Commission on April&nbsp;23, 1999).</FONT></TD>
</TR>

&nbsp;Inc.'s Form&nbsp;10-K (File No.&nbsp;001-13426) filed with the Commission on April&nbsp;23, 1999).</FONT></TD>
</TR>

First Amendment to Amended and Restated License Agreement, dated April&nbsp;2, 2004 between TSA Stores,&nbsp;Inc. (formerly known as The Sports Authority,&nbsp;Inc.), The Sports Authority Michigan,&nbsp;Inc. and Mega Sports Co.,
&nbsp;Ltd.*</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=84,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="1",CHK=891966,FOLIO='II-6',FILE='DISK022:[04DEN7.04DEN1607]KA1607A.;6',USER='MBRADT',CD='15-APR-2004;12:57' -->

<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04DEN1607_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ba1606_1_1"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.2  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ba1606_joinder_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ba1606_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>JOINDER AGREEMENT    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS JOINDER AGREEMENT ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Agreement</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") dated as of December&nbsp;18, 2003 is made and entered into by and among
The Sports Authority,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware corporation (formerly known as Gart Sports Company) (hereinafter referred to as "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Parent</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), each of the
Subsidiaries of Parent signatory hereto (such Subsidiaries identified on the signatory pages&nbsp;hereof as "Existing Borrowers" are, together with Parent, hereinafter referred to collectively and
individually, jointly and severally, as the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Existing Borrowers</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>," and each, individually, as an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Existing
Borrower</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), and New Borrowers (defined below), on the one hand, and the lenders identified on the signature pages hereof (such lenders, together with their respective
successors and assigns, are referred to hereinafter each individually as a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Lender</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" and collectively as the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Lenders</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), and The CIT Group/Business Credit,&nbsp;Inc., a New York corporation (in its capacity as agent for the Lenders, the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Agent</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), on the other hand. Initially capitalized terms used herein and not defined herein shall have the meanings assigned to them in the Financing
Agreement (defined below). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><I>RECITALS</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Existing
Borrowers and Lenders have previously entered into that certain Financing Agreement, dated as of August&nbsp;4, 2003 (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Financing
Agreement</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), pursuant to which, subject to the terms and conditions set forth therein, the Lenders acting through the Agent have made certain credit facilities available to the
Existing Borrowers; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Existing
Borrowers have informed Agent that the Parent intends to make the following fundamental corporate changes affecting certain of the Existing Borrowers
(collectively, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Restructure</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Parent
has already formed TSA Corporate Services,&nbsp;Inc., a Colorado corporation ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TSA Services</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), and TSA Gift
Card,&nbsp;Inc., a Virginia corporation ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TSA Gift Card</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>", and collectively, jointly and severally, with TSA Services, "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>New
Borrowers</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" and each, individually, a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>New Borrower</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sportmart,&nbsp;Inc.,
a Delaware corporation, will be merged with and into its parent, Gart Bros. Sporting Goods Co., a Colorado corporation
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>GBSGC</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;GBSGC
will be merged with and into TSA Stores,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware corporation ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TSA Stores</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Oshman's
Sporting Goods,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware corporation ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Oshman's</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), will be merged with and into TSA Stores; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Oshman's
Sporting Goods,&nbsp;Inc.&#151;Services, a Delaware corporation, a subsidiary of Oshman's, will be merged with and into TSA Services; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TSA
Stores will contribute all of its domestic intellectual property rights to The Sports Authority Michigan,&nbsp;Inc., a Michigan corporation
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>TSA Michigan</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TSA
Michigan will contribute its intellectual property rights (including, without limitation, such rights acquired from TSA Stores) to TSA Services; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;TSA
Stores will contribute its sole Michigan store (acquired by merger with Oshman's) to TSA Michigan; </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
connection with the Restructure, Existing Borrowers have requested that the Agent and the Lenders permit New Borrowers to be added and joined as additional Borrowers
under the Financing
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="2",CHK=919743,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]BA1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:55' -->
<A NAME="page_ba1606_1_2"> </A>
Agreement and, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, Agent and Lenders have agreed to permit such additions; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Existing
Borrowers, New Borrowers, Lenders and the Agent desire to enter into this Agreement in order to provide for the joinder of New Borrower as "Borrowers" under the
Financing Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><I>AGREEMENT</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing premises, the mutual covenants and conditions herein contained, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and
sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Joinder</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Each of TSA Services and TSA Gift Card hereby agrees as follows in favor of the Agent and Lenders: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
as of the date hereof, each New Borrower hereby agrees to become a Borrower under, and to bind itself to the Financing Agreement and each other Loan Document
to which the Borrowers are bound generally as of the date hereof, and, in such capacity, to jointly and severally assume and bind itself to all debts, liabilities and obligations of the Borrowers
thereunder (including, without limitation, all Obligations). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
furtherance but without limitation of the foregoing, as security for the prompt payment in full of all Obligations, each of the New Borrowers hereby pledges and
grants to the Agent on behalf of the Lenders a continuing general lien upon, and security interest in, all their Collateral. To facilitate the foregoing grant of a security interest, each New Borrower
agrees to execute (and, if required by Agent, acknowledge) and deliver to the Agent such instruments and agreements as the Agent may require in connection herewith, including without limitation,
UCC-1 financing statements, collateral assignments, legal opinions, resolutions, incumbency certificates, good standing certificates, qualifications to do business and other, related
documents, instruments, certificates or agreements as Agent may reasonably request to give effect to this joinder of each New Borrower as a Borrower. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
induce the Agent and Lenders to accept each New Borrower as a Borrower, New Borrower hereby agrees to and makes each and every representation and warranty made in the
Financing Agreement and the other Loan Documents in respect of the Borrowers generally, as fully and completely as if each New Borrower were an original party thereto (except to the extent that such
representations and warranties relate solely to an earlier date), subject, however, to the disclosures set forth on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1(c)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> attached
hereto. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Conditions to the Effectiveness of this Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Conditions Precedent</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Agreement shall not become effective unless and until the Agent shall have received each of
the documents and other items listed in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;2(a)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> attached hereto, each to be in form and substance satisfactory to the Agent and its
counsel, and, as applicable, duly executed and delivered by the party or parties thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Condition Subsequent</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. On or before January&nbsp;31, 2004 (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Restructure
Deadline</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the Borrowers shall either (i)&nbsp;consummate the Restructure (including, without limitation, delivery to the Agent of the stock certificates of TSA Michigan and
New Borrowers) or (ii)&nbsp;tender to the Agent the stock certificates of TSA Michigan, The Sports Authority Florida,&nbsp;Inc., a Florida corporation, and Authority International,&nbsp;Inc., a
Delaware corporation. The failure by Borrowers to comply with the foregoing condition by the Restructure Deadline shall constitute an Event of Default under the Financing Agreement.
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="2",CHK=607783,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]BA1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:55' -->
<A NAME="page_ba1606_1_3"> </A></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Miscellaneous</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Effect of Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. All references to Borrowers in the Financing Agreement and the other Loan Documents shall be deemed
to include each New Borrower with the same force and effect as if each New Borrower were an original signatory thereto. The Financing Agreement shall be read in conjunction with this Agreement. This
Agreement shall be considered a Loan Document. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Reaffirmation of Representations and Warranties</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Subject to the disclosures set forth on </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1(a)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, each Existing Borrower hereby ratifies and reaffirms all of
the representations and warranties set forth in the Financing
Agreement and the other Loan Documents, except to the extent that such representations and warranties relate to an earlier date. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Ratification</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Each Existing Borrower hereby restates, ratifies and reaffirms each and every term and condition set forth
in the Financing Agreement and the Loan Documents effective as of the date hereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Estoppel</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. To induce the Agent and Lenders to enter into this Agreement, Borrowers hereby acknowledge and agree that, as
of the date hereof, no Default or Event of Default has occurred and is continuing and, in addition, there exists no right of offset, defense, counterclaim or objection in favor of any Borrower in
respect to any Obligations. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Governing Law</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of California
and all applicable federal laws of the United States of America. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Costs and Expenses</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Borrowers agree to pay on demand all reasonable costs and expenses of the Agent in connection with
the preparation, execution, delivery and enforcement of this Agreement and all other agreements and instruments executed in connection herewith, including, without limitation, the reasonable fees and
out-of-pocket expenses of the Agent's counsel and the cost of any searches respecting the New Borrowers or their assets. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Counterparts; Effectiveness</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts and by different parties on
separate counterparts, including by facsimile signature, each of which when so executed and delivered shall be deemed to be an original. All such counterparts, taken together, shall constitute but one
and the same Agreement. This Agreement shall become effective upon the execution of a counterpart of this Agreement by each of the parties hereto. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>[</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>the remainder of this page&nbsp;left blank intentionally; signatures to follow</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>] </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="2",CHK=367110,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]BA1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:55' -->
</FONT></P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_bc1606_1_1"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Joinder Agreement to be executed and delivered by their proper and duly authorized officers as of the date set forth above. </FONT></P>

&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>AGENT:</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="46%"><BR><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><BR><FONT SIZE=2><B>THE CIT GROUP/BUSINESS CREDIT, INC., </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>a New York corporation</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="46%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
By:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="42%"><BR><HR NOSHADE></TD>

request; (2)&nbsp;a certified copy of the articles of incorporation of TSA Services; (3)&nbsp;a certified copy of the by-laws of TSA Services; and (4)&nbsp;signature and incumbency

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B><BR>

<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE=2><B><BR>
&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><B><BR>&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
