<P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=7,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=420832,FOLIO='vi',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CC1606A.;6',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
</FONT></P>

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ce1606_1_1"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>PREAMBLE  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Sports Authority 401(k)&nbsp;Retirement Plan, originally effective as of December&nbsp;1, 1994, is hereby amended and restated in its entirety. This
amendment and restatement shall be effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2004. The Plan, as amended and restated hereby, is intended to qualify as a profit-sharing plan under Code Section&nbsp;401(a),
and includes a cash or deferred arrangement that is intended to qualify under Code Section&nbsp;401(k). The Plan is maintained for the exclusive benefit of eligible employees and their
beneficiaries. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, a Participant's vested interest in his Account under the Plan on and after the effective date of this amendment and
restatement shall be not less than his vested interest in his account on the day immediately preceding the effective date. Any provision of the Plan that restricted or limited withdrawals, loans, or
other distributions, or otherwise required separate accounting with respect to any portion of a Participant's Account immediately prior to the later of the effective date of this amendment and
restatement or the date this amendment and restatement is adopted and the elimination of which would adversely affect the qualification of the Plan under Code Section&nbsp;401(a)&nbsp;shall
continue in effect with respect to such portion of the Participant's Account as if fully set forth in this amendment and restatement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any
sample amendment adopted by the Sponsor prior to this amendment and restatement for purposes of complying with EGTRRA shall continue in effect after this amendment and restatement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
as of January&nbsp;1, 2004 (the "merger date"), the Gart Sports Company Retirement Savings Plan (the "merged plan") is merged into and made a part of the Plan. All assets and
liabilities of the "merged plan" are transferred to and made a part of the Plan. Each Employee who was eligible to participate in the "merged plan" immediately prior to the "merger date" shall
continue to be eligible to participate in the Plan on and after the "merger date". In no event shall a Participant's vested interest in his Sub-Account attributable to amounts transferred
to the Plan from the "merged plan" (his "transferee Sub-Account") on and after the "merger date" be less than his vested interest in his account under the "merged plan" immediately prior
to the "merger date". Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, a Participant's service credited for eligibility and vesting purposes under the "merged plan" as of the "merger
date", if any, shall be included as Eligibility and Vesting Service under the Plan to the extent Eligibility and Vesting Service are credited under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE I<BR>
DEFINITIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Plan Definitions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As used herein, the following words and phrases have the meanings hereinafter set forth, unless a different meaning is plainly required by the context: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Account</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the account maintained by the Trustee in the name of a Participant that reflects his interest in the Trust and any
Sub-Accounts maintained thereunder, as provided in Article&nbsp;VIII. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Additional Discretionary Matching Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Matching Contribution made to the Plan at an Employer's discretion in
addition to the Employer's Regular Matching Contribution as provided in Article&nbsp;VI. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Administrator</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Sponsor unless the Sponsor designates another person or persons to act as such. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>After-Tax Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any after-tax employee contribution made by a Participant to the Plan as may be
permitted under Article&nbsp;V or as may have been permitted under the terms of the
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=8,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=562016,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CE1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ce1606_1_2"> </A>
Plan prior to this amendment and restatement or any after-tax employee contribution made by a Participant to another plan that is transferred directly to the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Beneficiary</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of a Participant means the person or persons entitled under the provisions of the Plan to receive distribution hereunder
in the event the Participant dies before receiving distribution of his entire interest under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
Participant's "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Benefit Payment Date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the first day on which all events have occurred which entitle the Participant to receive
payment of his benefit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Break in Service</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any "computation period" (as defined in Section&nbsp;2.1 for purposes of determining&nbsp;years of Vesting
Service) during which a person completes fewer than 501 Hours of Service except that no person shall incur a Break in Service solely by reason of temporary absence from work not exceeding
12&nbsp;months resulting from illness, layoff, or other cause if authorized in advance by an Employer or a Related Company pursuant to its uniform leave policy, if his employment shall not otherwise
be terminated during the period of such absence. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Code</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended from time to time. Reference to a Code section&nbsp;includes such
section&nbsp;and any comparable section&nbsp;or sections&nbsp;of any future legislation that amends, supplements, or supersedes such section. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Compensation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of a Participant for any period means the wages as defined in Code Section&nbsp;3401(a), determined without regard to
any rules that limit compensation included in wages based on the nature or location of the employment or services performed, and all other payments made to him for such period for services as an
Employee for which his Employer is required to furnish the Participant a written statement under Code Sections&nbsp;6041(d), 6051(a)(3), and 6052 (commonly referred to as W-2 earnings),
but excluding moving expenses incurred by the Participant to the extent that at the time of payment it is reasonable to believe that such amounts are deductible by the Participant under Code
Section&nbsp;217. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, Compensation shall not include the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>bonuses.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>commissions.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>travel
reimbursements, company auto expense and specific taxable incentive gifts. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
addition to the foregoing, Compensation includes any amount that would have been included in the foregoing description, but for the Participant's election to defer payment of such
amount under Code
Section&nbsp;125, 402(e)(3), 402(h)(1)(B), 403(b), or 457(b)&nbsp;and certain contributions described in Code Section&nbsp;414(h)(2)&nbsp;that are picked up by the employing unit and treated
as employer contributions. Effective for Plan Years beginning on and after January&nbsp;1, 2001, Compensation shall also include any amount that is not included in the Participant's taxable gross
income pursuant to Code Section&nbsp;132(f). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
no event, however, shall the Compensation of a Participant taken into account under the Plan for any Plan Year exceed $150,000 (subject to adjustment annually as provided in Code
Sections&nbsp;401(a)(17)(B)&nbsp;and 415(d); provided, however, that the dollar increase in effect on January&nbsp;1 of any calendar year, if any, is effective for Plan Years beginning in such
calendar year). If the Compensation of a Participant is determined over a period of time that contains fewer than 12 calendar&nbsp;months, then the annual compensation limitation described above
shall be adjusted with respect to that Participant by multiplying the annual compensation limitation in effect for the Plan Year by a fraction the numerator of which is the number of
full&nbsp;months in the period and the denominator of which is 12; provided, however, that no proration is required for a Participant who is covered under
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=9,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=393589,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CE1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ce1606_1_3"> </A>
the Plan for less than one full Plan Year if the formula for allocations is based on Compensation for a period of at least 12&nbsp;months. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Contribution Period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the period specified in Article&nbsp;VI for which Employer Contributions shall be made. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Disabled</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a Participant can no longer continue in the service of his employer because of a mental or physical condition that is
likely to result in death or is expected to continue for a period of at least six&nbsp;months. A Participant shall be considered Disabled only if the Administrator determines he is Disabled based on
a written certificate of a physician acceptable to it. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Eligible Employee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Employee who has met the eligibility requirements of Article&nbsp;III to participate in the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Eligibility Service</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of an employee means the period or periods of service credited to him under the provisions of Article&nbsp;II
for purposes of determining his eligibility to participate in the Plan as may be required under Article&nbsp;III. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Employee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any person who is classified by an Employer, in accordance with its payroll records, as an employee of the Employer,
other than any such person who is either (i)&nbsp;covered by a collective bargaining agreement that does not specifically provide for coverage under the Plan or (ii)&nbsp;a nonresident alien who
does not receive United States source income. Any individual who is not treated by an Employer as a common law employee of the Employer shall be excluded from Plan participation
even if a court or administrative agency determines that such individual is a common law employee and not an independent contractor. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Employer</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Sponsor and any entity which has adopted the Plan as may be provided under Article&nbsp;XX, including Authority
International; The Sports Authority Michigan,&nbsp;Inc.; and The Sports Authority Florida,&nbsp;Inc. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Employer Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the amount, if any, that an Employer contributes to the Plan as may be provided under Article&nbsp;VI
or Article&nbsp;XXII. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Enrollment Date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the first day of each calendar month. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>ERISA</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended from time to time. Reference to a section&nbsp;of ERISA
includes such section&nbsp;and any comparable section&nbsp;or sections&nbsp;of any future legislation that amends, supplements, or supersedes such section. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>General Fund</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a Trust Fund maintained by the Trustee as required to hold and administer any assets of the Trust that are not
allocated among any separate Investment Funds as may be provided in the Plan or the Trust Agreement. No General Fund shall be maintained if all assets of the Trust are allocated among separate
Investment Funds. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Highly Compensated Employee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Employee or former Employee who is a "highly compensated active employee" or a "highly
compensated former employee" as defined hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"highly compensated active employee" includes any Employee who performs services for an Employer or any Related Company during the Plan Year and who (i)&nbsp;was a five percent owner
at any time during the Plan Year or the "look back year" or (ii)&nbsp;received "compensation" from the Employers and Related Companies during the "look back year" in excess of $80,000 (subject to
adjustment annually at the same time and in the same manner as under Code Section&nbsp;415(d)) and was in the top paid group of employees for the "look back year". An Employee is in the top paid
group of employees if he is in the top 20&nbsp;percent of the employees of his Employer and all Related Companies when ranked on the basis of "compensation" paid during the "look back year".
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=10,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=987532,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CE1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ce1606_1_4"> </A></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"highly compensated former employee" includes any Employee who (1)&nbsp;separated from service from an Employer and all Related Companies (or is deemed to have separated from service
from an Employer and all Related Companies) prior to the Plan Year, (2)&nbsp;performed no services for an Employer or any Related Company during the Plan Year, and (3)&nbsp;was a "highly
compensated active employee" for either the separation year or any Plan Year ending on or after the date the Employee attains age 55, as determined under the rules in effect under Code
Section&nbsp;414(q) for such year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
determination of who is a Highly Compensated Employee hereunder, including determinations as to the number and identity of employees in the top paid group, shall be made in
accordance with the provisions of Code Section&nbsp;414(q) and regulations issued thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
purposes of this definition, the following terms have the following meanings: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
employee's "compensation" means compensation as defined in Code Section&nbsp;415(c)(3) and regulations issued thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"look back year" means the 12-month period immediately preceding the Plan Year. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Hour of Service</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" with respect to a person means each hour, if any, that may be credited to him in accordance with the provisions of
Article&nbsp;II. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Investment Fund</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any separate investment Trust Fund maintained by the Trustee as may be provided in the Plan or the Trust
Agreement or any separate investment fund maintained by the Trustee, to the extent that there are Participant Sub-Accounts under such funds, to which assets of the Trust may be allocated
and separately invested. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Matching Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Employer Contribution made to the Plan on account of a Participant's Tax-Deferred
Contributions as provided in Article&nbsp;VI, including Regular Matching Contributions and Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Normal Retirement Date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of an employee means the date he attains age 65. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Participant</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any person who has an Account in the Trust. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Plan</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Sports Authority 401(k)&nbsp;Retirement Plan, as from time to time in effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Plan Year</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the 12-consecutive-month period ending each December&nbsp;31. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Predecessor Employer</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any company that is a predecessor organization to an Employer under the Code. In addition, a Predecessor
Employer includes the following: Casey Sporting Goods Co., Dave Cook Sporting Goods Co., Sportsmart,&nbsp;Inc., Oshman's Sporting Goods,&nbsp;Inc., Gart Sports Company, and Kmart Corporation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Prior Employer Contributions</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means that portion of a Participant's Account that are attributable to employer contributions made on his
behalf prior to January&nbsp;1, 2003. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Prior Nonelective Contributions</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the portion of a Participant's Account that is attributable to nonelective contributions made by
the Employer on his behalf prior to January&nbsp;1, 2004. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Prior Safe Harbor Contributions</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the portion of a Participant's Account that is attributable to safe harbor contributions made on
his behalf prior to January&nbsp;1, 2004. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Qualified Nonelective Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Employer Contribution made to the Plan as provided in Article&nbsp;VI that is
100&nbsp;percent vested when made and may be taken into account to satisfy the limitations on Tax-Deferred Contributions and/or Matching Contributions made by or on behalf of Highly
Compensated Employees under Article&nbsp;VII. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Regular Matching Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any Matching Contribution made to the Plan at the rate specified in Article&nbsp;VI, other than
an Additional Discretionary Matching Contribution.
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=11,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=490812,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CE1606B.;5',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ce1606_1_5"> </A></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Related Company</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any corporation or business, other than an Employer, which would be aggregated with an Employer for a relevant
purpose under Code Section&nbsp;414. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
Participant's "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Required Beginning Date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for
a Participant who is not a "five percent owner", April&nbsp;1 of the calendar year following the calendar year in which occurs the later of the Participant's
(i)&nbsp;attainment of age 70<SUP>1</SUP>/<SMALL>2</SMALL> or (ii)&nbsp;Settlement Date. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for
a Participant who is a "five percent owner", April&nbsp;1 of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the Participant attains age
70<SUP>1</SUP>/<SMALL>2</SMALL>. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
Participant is a "five percent owner" if he is a five percent owner, as defined in Code Section&nbsp;416(i)&nbsp;and determined in accordance with Code Section&nbsp;416, but
without regard to whether the Plan is top-heavy, for the Plan Year ending with or within the calendar year in which the Participant attains age 70<SUP>1</SUP>/<SMALL>2</SMALL>. The Required Beginning
Date of a Participant who is a "five percent owner" hereunder shall not be redetermined if the Participant ceases to be a five percent owner as defined in Code Section&nbsp;416(i)&nbsp;with
respect to any subsequent Plan Year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Rollover Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any rollover contribution to the Plan made by a Participant as may be permitted under Article&nbsp;V. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Settlement Date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of a Participant means the date on which a Participant's interest under the Plan becomes distributable in accordance
with Article&nbsp;XV. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Sponsor</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means The Sports Authority,&nbsp;Inc., and any successor thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Sub-Account</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any of the individual sub-accounts of a Participant's Account that is maintained as provided
in Article&nbsp;VIII. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Tax-Deferred Contribution</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the amount contributed to the Plan on a Participant's behalf by his Employer in accordance
with Article&nbsp;IV. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Trust</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the trust, custodial accounts, annuity contracts, or insurance contracts maintained by the Trustee under the Trust
Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Trust Agreement</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any agreement or agreements entered into between the Sponsor and the Trustee relating to the holding,
investment, and reinvestment of the assets of the Plan, together with all amendments thereto and shall include any agreement establishing a custodial account, an annuity contract, or an insurance
contract (other than a life, health or accident, property, casualty, or liability insurance contract) for the investment of assets if the custodial account or contract would, except for the fact that
it is not a trust, constitute a qualified trust under Code Section&nbsp;401. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Trustee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the trustee or any successor trustee which at the time shall be designated, qualified, and acting under the Trust
Agreement and shall include any insurance company that issues an annuity or insurance contract pursuant to the Trust Agreement or any person holding assets in a custodial account pursuant to the Trust
Agreement. The Sponsor may designate a person or persons other than the Trustee to perform any responsibility of the Trustee under the Plan, other than trustee responsibilities as defined in ERISA
Section&nbsp;405(c)(3), and the Trustee shall not be liable for the performance of such person in carrying out such responsibility except as otherwise provided by ERISA. The term Trustee shall
include any delegate of the Trustee as may be provided in the Trust Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Trust Fund</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any fund maintained under the Trust by the Trustee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Valuation Date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the date or dates designated by the Sponsor and communicated in writing to the Trustee for the purpose of valuing
the General Fund and each Investment Fund and adjusting Accounts and Sub-Accounts hereunder, which dates need not be uniform with respect to the General Fund, each Investment Fund,
Account, or Sub-Account; provided, however, that the General
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=12,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=535591,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CE1606B.;5',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ce1606_1_6"> </A>
Fund and each Investment Fund shall be valued and each Account and Sub-Account shall be adjusted no less often than once annually. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Vesting Service</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of an employee means the period or periods of service credited to him under the provisions of Article&nbsp;II for
purposes of determining his vested interest in his Employer Contributions Sub-Account, if Employer Contributions are provided for under either Article&nbsp;VI or Article&nbsp;XXII. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interpretation  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Where required by the context, the noun, verb, adjective, and adverb forms of each defined term shall include any of its other forms. Wherever used herein, the
masculine pronoun shall include the feminine, the singular shall include the plural, and the plural shall include the singular. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE II<BR>
SERVICE  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Special Definitions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of this Article, the following terms have the following meanings. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>computation period</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" for purposes of determining an employee's&nbsp;years of Vesting Service means each Plan Year; provided, however,
that if an employee first completed an Hour of Service prior to the effective date of the Plan, a Plan Year shall not mean any short Plan Year beginning on the effective date of the Plan, if any, but
shall mean any 12-consecutive-month period beginning before the effective date of the Plan that would have been a Plan Year if the Plan had been in effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>continuous service</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of an employee means the continuous service credited to him in accordance with the provisions of this Article. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>employment commencement date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of an employee means the date he first completes an Hour of Service. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>maternity/paternity absence</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a person's absence from employment with an Employer or a Related Company because of the person's
pregnancy, the birth of the person's child, the placement of a child with the person in connection with the person's adoption of the child, or the caring for the person's child immediately following
the child's birth or adoption. A person's absence from employment will not be considered a maternity/paternity absence unless the person furnishes the Administrator such timely information as may
reasonably be required to establish that the absence was for one of the purposes enumerated in this paragraph and to establish the number of&nbsp;days of absence attributable to such purpose. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>reemployment commencement date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of an employee means the first date following a "severance date" on which he again completes an Hour
of Service. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>severance date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" of an employee means the earlier of (i)&nbsp;the date on which he retires, dies, or his employment with all
Employers and Related Companies is otherwise terminated, or (ii)&nbsp;the first anniversary of the first date of a period during which he is absent from work with all Employers and Related Companies
for any other reason; provided, however, that if he terminates employment with or is absent from work with all Employers and Related Companies on account of service with the armed forces of the United
States, he shall not incur a "severance date" if he is eligible for reemployment rights under the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994 and he returns to work with an
Employer or a Related Company within the period during which he retains such reemployment rights, but, if he does not return to work within such period, his "severance date" shall be the earlier of
the date which is one year after his absence commenced or the last day of the period during which he retains such reemployment rights; and provided, further, that if an employee is
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=13,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=699830,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CE1606B.;5',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ce1606_1_7"> </A>
on a "maternity/paternity absence" beyond the first anniversary of the first day of such absence, he shall not incur a "severance date" if he returns to employment before the second anniversary of the
first day of such absence but, if he does not return within such period, his "severance date" shall be the second anniversary of the first date of such "maternity/paternity absence"; and provided,
further, that if an employee is on a paid leave of absence beyond the first anniversary of the first day of such absence, he shall not incur a "severance date" if he returns to employment before the
second anniversary of the first day of such absence but, if he does not return within such period, his "severance date" shall be the first anniversary of the first date of such paid leave of absence. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Crediting of Hours of Service  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A person shall be credited with an Hour of Service for: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Each
hour for which he is paid, or entitled to payment, for the performance of duties for an Employer, a Predecessor Employer, or a Related Company during the applicable period;
provided, however, that&nbsp;hours compensated at a premium rate shall be treated as straight-time&nbsp;hours.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Subject
to the provisions of Section&nbsp;2.3, each hour for which he is paid, or entitled to payment, by an Employer, a Predecessor Employer, or a Related Company on account of a
period of time during which no duties are performed (irrespective of whether the employment relationship has terminated) due to vacation, holiday, illness, incapacity (including disability),
lay-off, jury duty, military duty, or leave of absence.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Each
hour for which he would have been scheduled to work for an Employer, a Predecessor Employer, or a Related Company during the period that he is absent from work because of service
with the armed forces of the United States provided he is eligible for reemployment rights under the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994 and returns to work with an
Employer or a Related Company within the period during which he retains such reemployment rights; provided, however, that the same Hour of Service shall not be credited under
paragraph&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;of this Section&nbsp;and under this paragraph&nbsp;(c).
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Each
hour for which back pay, irrespective of mitigation of damages, is either awarded or agreed to by an Employer, a Predecessor Employer, or a Related Company; provided, however,
that the same Hour of Service shall not be credited both under paragraph&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;or (b)&nbsp;or (c)&nbsp;of this Section, as the case may be, and under this paragraph&nbsp;(d); and
provided, further, that the crediting of Hours of Service for back pay awarded or agreed to with respect to periods described in such paragraph&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;shall be subject to the limitations
set forth therein and in Section&nbsp;2.3.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Solely
for purposes of determining whether a person who is on a "maternity/paternity absence" has incurred a Break in Service for a "computation period", Hours of Service shall
include those&nbsp;hours with which such person would otherwise have been credited but for such "maternity/paternity absence", or shall include eight Hours of Service for each day of
"maternity/paternity absence" if the actual&nbsp;hours to be credited cannot be determined; except that not more than the minimum number of&nbsp;hours required to prevent a Break in Service shall
be credited by reason of any "maternity/paternity absence"; provided, however, that any&nbsp;hours included as Hours of Service pursuant to this paragraph shall be credited to the "computation
period" in which the absence from employment begins, if such person otherwise would incur a Break in Service in such "computation period", or, in any other case, to the immediately following
"computation period". </FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=14,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=207920,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CE1606B.;5',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
</FONT></P>

</DD></DL>
</UL>
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_cg1606_1_8"> </A> </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(f)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Solely
for purposes of determining whether he has incurred a Break in Service, each hour for which he would have been scheduled to work for an Employer, a Predecessor Employer, or a
Related Company during the period of time that he is absent from work on an approved leave of absence pursuant to the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993; provided, however, that Hours of Service
shall not be credited to an employee under this paragraph if the employee fails to return to employment with an Employer or a Related Company following such leave. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except
as otherwise specifically provided with respect to Predecessor Employers, Hours of Service shall not be credited for employment with a corporation or business prior to the date
such corporation or business becomes a Related Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, for calendar&nbsp;years prior to January&nbsp;1, 1995 and solely with respect to any Participant as of December&nbsp;1, 1994, employment with Kmart
Corporation shall be considered employment with an Employer for Vesting purposes under the Plan by: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>crediting
the Participant with one year of Vesting Service for the year in which he first completed an hour for which he was paid or entitled to payment by Kmart Corporation if such
hour was completed prior to August&nbsp;1 of that year; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>crediting
that Participant with one year of Vesting Service for each subsequent calendar year through December&nbsp;31, 1994 if he was employed by Kmart during that calendar year. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
August&nbsp;4, 2003, employment with the Sports Authority,&nbsp;Inc. (formerly known as Gart Sports Company), shall be treated as employment with an Employer. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Limitations on Crediting of Hours of Service  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the application of the provisions of paragraph&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;2.2, the following shall apply: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>An
hour for which a person is directly or indirectly paid, or entitled to payment, on account of a period during which no duties are performed shall not be credited to him if such
payment is made or due under a plan maintained solely for the purpose of complying with applicable workers' compensation, unemployment compensation, or disability insurance laws.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Hours
of Service shall not be credited with respect to a payment which solely reimburses a person for medical or medically-related expenses incurred by him.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>A
payment shall be deemed to be made by or due from an Employer, a Predecessor Employer, or a Related Company (i)&nbsp;regardless of whether such payment is made by or due from such
employer directly or indirectly, through (among others) a trust fund or insurer to which any such employer contributes or pays premiums, and (ii)&nbsp;regardless of whether contributions made or due
to such trust fund, insurer, or other entity are for the benefit of particular persons or are on behalf of a group of persons in the aggregate.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>No
more than 501 Hours of Service shall be credited to a person on account of any single continuous period during which he performs no duties (whether or not such period occurs in a
single "computation period"), unless no duties are performed due to service with the armed forces of the United States for which the person retains reemployment rights as provided in
paragraph&nbsp;(c) of Section&nbsp;2.2 or because of approved leaves of absence of up to two&nbsp;years. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Department of Labor Rules  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The rules set forth in paragraphs (b)&nbsp;and (c)&nbsp;of Department of Labor Regulations Section&nbsp;2530.200b-2, which relate to determining
Hours of Service attributable to reasons other than the performance of duties and crediting Hours of Service to particular periods, are hereby incorporated into the Plan by reference.
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=15,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=920878,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CG1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_cg1606_1_9"> </A></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Crediting of Continuous Service  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A person shall be credited with "continuous service" for the aggregate of the periods of time between his "employment commencement date" or any "reemployment
commencement date" and the "severance date" that next follows such "employment commencement date" or "reemployment commencement date"; provided, however, that an employee who has a "reemployment
commencement date" within the 12-consecutive-month period following the earlier of the first date of his absence or his "severance date" shall be credited with "continuous service" for the
period between his "severance date" and "reemployment commencement date". </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligibility Service  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An employee shall be credited with Eligibility Service equal to his "continuous service". Eligibility Service shall be computed in full&nbsp;months treating
each calendar month or portion of a calendar month in which an employee is credited with "continuous service" as a month of Eligibility Service. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Years of Vesting Service  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An employee shall be credited with a year of Vesting Service for each "computation period" during which he completes at least 1,000 Hours of Service. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Crediting of Hours of Service with Respect to Short Computation Periods  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following provisions shall apply with respect to crediting Hours of Service with respect to any short "computation period": </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For
purposes of this Article, the following terms have the following meanings:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>An
"old computation period" means any "computation period" that ends immediately prior to a change in the "computation period".
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>A
"short computation period" means any "computation period" of fewer than 12 consecutive&nbsp;months.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Notwithstanding
any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, no person shall incur a Break in Service for a short "computation period" solely because of such short "computation
period".
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>For
purposes of determining the&nbsp;years of Vesting Service to be credited to an Employee, a "computation period" shall not include the "short computation period", but if an
Employee completes at least 1,000 Hours of Service in the 12-consecutive-month period beginning on the first day of the "short computation period", such Employee shall be credited with a
year of Vesting Service for such 12-consecutive-month period. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Crediting of Service on Transfer or Amendment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, if an Employee is transferred from employment covered under a qualified plan maintained by an
Employer or a Related Company for which service for purposes of eligibility to participate is credited based on Hours of Service and computation periods in accordance with Department of Labor
Regulations Section&nbsp;2530.200 through 2530.203 to employment covered under the Plan or, prior to amendment, the Plan provided for crediting of service for purposes of eligibility to participate
on the basis of Hours of Service and computation periods in accordance with Department of Labor Regulations Section&nbsp;2530.200 through 2530.203, an affected Employee shall be credited with
Eligibility Service hereunder as provided in Treasury Regulations Section&nbsp;1.410(a)-7(f)(1).
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=16,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=152168,FOLIO='9',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CG1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_cg1606_1_10"> </A></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
addition, notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, if an Employee is transferred from employment covered under a qualified plan maintained by an Employer or a
Related Company for which service for purposes of vesting is credited based on elapsed time in accordance with Treasury Regulations Section&nbsp;1.410(a)-7 to employment covered under
the Plan or, prior to amendment, the Plan provided for crediting of service for purposes of vesting on the basis of
elapsed time in accordance with Treasury Regulations Section&nbsp;1.410(a)-7, an affected Employee shall be credited with Vesting Service hereunder as provided in Treasury Regulations
Section&nbsp;1.410(a)-7(f)(1). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>2.10&nbsp;Crediting of Service to Leased Employees  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, a "leased employee" working for an Employer or a Related Company (other than an "excludable
leased employee") shall be considered an employee of such Employer or Related Company for purposes of Eligibility and Vesting Service crediting under the Plan, but shall not be eligible to participate
in the Plan. Such "leased employee" shall also be considered an employee of such Employer or Related Company for purposes of applying Code Sections&nbsp;401(a)(3), (4), (7), and (16), and 408(k),
415, and 416. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
"leased employee" means any person who performs services for an Employer or a Related Company (the "recipient") (other than an employee of the "recipient") pursuant to an agreement
between the "recipient" and any other person (the "leasing organization") on a substantially full-time basis for a period of at least one year, provided that such services are performed
under primary direction of or control by the "recipient". An "excludable leased employee" means any "leased employee" of the "recipient" who is covered by a money purchase pension plan maintained by
the "leasing organization" which provides for (i)&nbsp;a nonintegrated employer contribution on behalf of each participant in the plan equal to at least ten percent of compensation, (ii)&nbsp;full
and immediate vesting, and (iii)&nbsp;immediate participation by employees of the "leasing organization" (other than employees who perform substantially all of their services for the "leasing
organization" or whose compensation from the "leasing organization" in each plan year during the four-year period ending with the plan year is less than $1,000); provided, however, that
"leased employees" do not constitute more than 20&nbsp;percent of the "recipient's" nonhighly compensated work force. For purposes of this Section, contributions or benefits provided to a "leased
employee" by the "leasing organization" that are attributable to services performed for the "recipient" shall be treated as provided by the "recipient". </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE III<BR>
ELIGIBILITY  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligibility  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Employee who was an Eligible Employee immediately prior to January&nbsp;1, 2004 shall continue to be an Eligible Employee on January&nbsp;1, 2004. Each
other Employee shall become an Eligible Employee
as of the Enrollment Date coinciding with or next following the date on which he has both attained age 21 and completed <SUP>1</SUP>/<SMALL>4</SMALL> year of Eligibility Service. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transfers of Employment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a person is transferred directly from employment with an Employer or with a Related Company in a capacity other than as an Employee to employment as an
Employee, he shall become an Eligible Employee as of the date he is so transferred if prior to an Enrollment Date coinciding with or preceding such transfer date he has met the eligibility
requirements of Section&nbsp;3.1. Otherwise, the eligibility of a person who is so transferred to participate in the Plan shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.1.
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=17,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=820131,FOLIO='10',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CG1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_cg1606_1_11"> </A></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reemployment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a person who terminated employment with an Employer and all Related Companies is reemployed as an Employee and if he had been an Eligible Employee prior to his
termination of employment, he shall again become an Eligible Employee on the date he is reemployed. Otherwise, the eligibility of a person who terminated employment with an Employer and all Related
Companies and who is reemployed by an Employer or a Related Company to participate in the Plan shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.1 or 3.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notification Concerning New Eligible Employees  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Employer shall notify the Administrator as soon as practicable of Employees becoming Eligible Employees as of any date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>3.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effect and Duration  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon becoming an Eligible Employee, an Employee shall be entitled to make Tax-Deferred Contributions to the Plan in accordance with the provisions of
Article&nbsp;IV and receive allocations of Employer Contributions in accordance with the provisions of Article&nbsp;VI (provided he meets any applicable requirements thereunder) and shall be bound
by all the terms and conditions of the Plan and the Trust Agreement. A person shall continue as an Eligible Employee eligible to make Tax-Deferred Contributions to the Plan and to
participate in allocations of Employer Contributions only so long as he continues employment as an Employee. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE IV<BR>
TAX-DEFERRED CONTRIBUTIONS  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tax-Deferred Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective as of the date he becomes an Eligible Employee, each Eligible Employee may elect, in accordance with rules prescribed by the Administrator, to have
Tax-Deferred Contributions made to the Plan on his behalf by his Employer as hereinafter provided. An Eligible Employee's election shall include his authorization for his Employer to
reduce his Compensation and to make Tax-Deferred Contributions on his behalf. An Eligible Employee who elects not to have Tax-Deferred Contributions made to the Plan as of the
first Enrollment Date he becomes eligible to participate may change his election by amending his reduction authorization as prescribed in this Article. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tax-Deferred
Contributions on behalf of an Eligible Employee shall commence as soon as administratively practicable on or after the date on which his election is effective. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amount of Tax-Deferred Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The amount of Tax-Deferred Contributions to be made to the Plan on behalf of an Eligible Employee by his Employer shall be an integral percentage of
his Compensation of not less than one percent nor more than 15&nbsp;percent. In the event an Eligible Employee elects to have his Employer make Tax-Deferred Contributions on his behalf,
his Compensation shall be reduced for each payroll period by the percentage he elects to have contributed on his behalf to the Plan in accordance with the terms of his currently effective reduction
authorization. The Employer may, in its discretion, limit the Tax-Deferred Contributions for Highly Compensated Employees. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments to Reduction Authorization  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Eligible Employee may elect, in the manner prescribed by the Administrator, to change the amount of his future Compensation that his Employer contributes on
his behalf as Tax-Deferred Contributions. An Eligible Employee may amend his reduction authorization at such time or times
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=18,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=218384,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CG1606B.;4',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_cg1606_1_12"> </A>
during the Plan Year as the Administrator may prescribe by giving such number of&nbsp;days advance notice of his election as the Administrator may prescribe. An Eligible Employee who amends his
reduction authorization shall be limited to selecting an amount of his Compensation that is otherwise permitted under this Article&nbsp;IV. Tax-Deferred Contributions shall be made on
behalf of such Eligible Employee by his Employer pursuant to his properly amended reduction authorization commencing with Compensation paid to the Eligible Employee on or after the date such amendment
is effective, until otherwise altered or terminated in accordance with the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Suspension of Tax-Deferred Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Eligible Employee on whose behalf Tax-Deferred Contributions are being made may elect, in the manner prescribed by the Administrator, to have such
contributions suspended at any time by giving such number of&nbsp;days advance notice of his election as the Administrator may prescribe. Any such voluntary suspension shall take effect commencing
with Compensation paid to such Eligible Employee on or after the expiration of the required notice period and shall remain in effect until Tax-Deferred Contributions are resumed as
hereinafter set forth. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Resumption of Tax-Deferred Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Eligible Employee who has voluntarily suspended his Tax-Deferred Contributions may elect, in the manner prescribed by the Administrator, to have
such contributions resumed. An Eligible Employee may make such election at such time or times during the Plan Year as the Administrator may prescribe, by giving such number of&nbsp;days advance
notice of his election as the Administrator may prescribe. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Delivery of Tax-Deferred Contributions  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As soon after the date an amount would otherwise be paid to an Employee as it can reasonably be separated from Employer assets, each Employer shall cause to be
delivered to the Trustee in cash all Tax-Deferred Contributions attributable to such amounts. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>4.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting of Tax-Deferred Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant's vested interest in his Tax-Deferred Contributions Sub-Account shall be at all times 100&nbsp;percent. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE V<BR>
AFTER-TAX AND ROLLOVER CONTRIBUTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>5.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior After-Tax Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligible Employees are not currently permitted to make After-Tax Contributions to the Plan. However, the Plan includes assets attributable to
After-Tax Contributions made to the Plan prior to the effective date of this amendment and restatement or transferred to the Plan from another qualified plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>5.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Rollover Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Employee who was a participant in a plan qualified under Code Section&nbsp;401 and who receives (or is eligible to receive) a cash distribution from such
plan that he elects either (i)&nbsp;to roll over immediately to a qualified retirement plan or (ii)&nbsp;to roll over into a conduit IRA from which he receives a later cash distribution, may elect
to make a Rollover Contribution to the Plan if he is entitled under Code Section&nbsp;402(c)&nbsp;or 408(d)(3)(A)&nbsp;to roll over such distribution to another qualified retirement plan. The
Administrator may require an Employee to provide it with such information as it
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=19,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=979428,FOLIO='12',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CG1606B.;4',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_cg1606_1_13"> </A>
deems necessary or desirable to show that he is entitled to roll over such distribution to another qualified retirement plan. An Employee shall make a Rollover Contribution to the Plan by delivering,
or causing to be delivered, to the Trustee the cash that constitutes the Rollover Contribution amount. If the Employee received a cash distribution that he is rolling over, such delivery must be made
within 60&nbsp;days of receipt of the distribution from the plan or from the conduit IRA in the manner prescribed by the Administrator. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>5.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting of After-Tax Contributions and Rollover Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant's vested interest in his After-Tax Contributions Sub-Account and Rollover Contributions Sub-Account shall be at
all times 100&nbsp;percent. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VI<BR>
EMPLOYER CONTRIBUTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contribution Period  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Contribution Periods for Employer Contributions shall be as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Contribution Period for Regular Matching Contributions under the Plan is payroll period.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Contribution Period for Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions is each Plan Year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Contribution Period for Qualified Nonelective Contributions under the Plan is each Plan Year. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Qualified Nonelective Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Employer may, in its discretion, make a Qualified Nonelective Contribution to the Plan for the Contribution Period in an amount determined by the Sponsor. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Allocation of Qualified Nonelective Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Qualified Nonelective Contribution made for a Contribution Period shall be allocated among the Eligible Employees during the Contribution Period who have met
the allocation requirements for Qualified Nonelective Contributions described in this Article, other than any such Eligible Employee who is a Highly Compensated Employee, in accordance with one of the
following options, as determined by the Administrator: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Flat
Dollar Amount: The allocable share of each such Eligible Employee in the Qualified Nonelective Contribution shall be a flat dollar amount, as determined by the Sponsor for the
Contribution Period.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Order
of "test compensation": The allocable share of each such Eligible Employee in the Qualified Nonelective Contribution shall be determined as follows:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
Eligible Employee with the least "test compensation", as defined in Section&nbsp;7.1, shall receive an allocation equal to the lower of:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(A)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
maximum contribution permitted to be made to the Plan on his behalf under Code Section&nbsp;415, taking into account any contributions already made on his behalf; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(B)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
full amount of the Qualified Nonelective Contribution made by the Employer for the Contribution Period. </FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=20,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=191382,FOLIO='13',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CG1606B.;4',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
</FONT></P>

</DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ci1606_1_14"> </A> </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
any Qualified Nonelective Employer Contribution remains after allocation has been made in accordance with the provisions of paragraph&nbsp;(a) above, the Eligible Employee with
the next lowest "test compensation", as defined in Section&nbsp;7.1, shall receive an allocation equal to the lower of:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(A)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
maximum contribution permitted to be made to the Plan on his behalf under Code Section&nbsp;415, taking into account any contributions already made on his behalf; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(B)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
balance of the Qualified Nonelective Contribution made by the Employer for the Contribution Period remaining after allocation has been made in accordance with the provisions of
paragraph&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;above.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>If
any Qualified Nonelective Contribution remains after allocation has been made in accordance with the provisions of paragraph&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;above, allocations shall continue
to Eligible Employees as provided in paragraph&nbsp;(b) in ascending order of "test compensation", until the Qualified Nonelective Contribution has been fully allocated. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amount and Allocation of Regular Matching Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Employer may, in its discretion, make a Regular Matching Contribution to the Plan for each Contribution Period on behalf of each of its Eligible Employees
who has met the allocation requirements for Regular Matching Contributions described in this Article. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
amount of any such Regular Matching Contribution with respect to similarly situated Eligible Employees, as determined by the Employer in a non-discriminatory manner,
shall be equal to a uniform percentage, determined by the Employer, in its discretion, of the Tax-Deferred Contributions made for the Contribution Period on behalf of such similarly
situated Eligible Employees. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to its Regular Matching Contribution, each Employer may make an Additional Discretionary Matching Contribution to the Plan for each Contribution
Period on behalf of each of its Eligible Employees who has met the allocation requirements for Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions described in this Article. The amount of any such
Additional Discretionary Matching Contribution with respect to similarly situated Eligible Employees, as determined by the Employer in a non-discriminatory manner, shall be equal to a
uniform percentage, determined by the Employer, in its discretion, of the Tax-Deferred Contributions made on behalf of each such similarly situated Eligible Employee for the Contribution
Period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Verification of Amount of Employer Contributions by the Sponsor  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Sponsor shall verify the amount of Employer Contributions to be made by each Employer in accordance with the provisions of the Plan. Notwithstanding any other
provision of the Plan to the contrary, the Sponsor shall determine the portion of the Employer Contribution to be made by each Employer with respect to an Employee who transfers from employment with
one Employer as an Employee to employment with another Employer as an Employee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment of Employer Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employer Contributions made for a Contribution Period shall be paid in cash to the Trustee within the period of time required under the Code in order for the
contribution to be deductible by the Employer in determining its Federal income taxes for the Plan Year.
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=21,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=438290,FOLIO='14',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CI1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ci1606_1_15"> </A></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Allocation Requirements for Employer Contributions  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A person who was an Eligible Employee at any time during a Contribution Period shall be eligible to receive an allocation of Regular Matching Contributions for
such Contribution Period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
person who was an Eligible Employee during a Contribution Period shall be eligible to receive an allocation of Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions for such Contribution
Period only if (i)&nbsp;he is employed on the last day of the Contribution Period and (ii)&nbsp;he has completed at least 1,000 Hours of Service during the Contribution Period. The number of Hours
of Service required to receive an allocation of Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions hereunder shall be pro-rated for any short Contribution Period. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
person who was an Eligible Employee at any time during a Contribution Period shall be eligible to receive an allocation of Qualified Nonelective Contributions for such Contribution
Period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting of Employer Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant's vested interest in his Qualified Nonelective Contributions, Prior Safe Harbor Contributions and Prior Employer Contributions
Sub-Accounts shall be at all times 100&nbsp;percent. A Participant who was formerly employed by TSA Stores,&nbsp;Inc. prior to January&nbsp;1, 2004, shall be at all times
100&nbsp;percent vested in the Prior Safe Harbor Matching Contributions and Regular Matching Contributions in his Account. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
Participant's vested interest in his Prior Nonelective Contributions Sub-Account shall be zero percent until he has completed five&nbsp;years of Vesting Service, in which
event his vested interest on his Prior Nonelective Contributions Sub-Account shall be 100&nbsp;percent. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With
respect to Participants other than former employees of TSA Stores,&nbsp;Inc., a Participant's vested interest in his Regular and Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions
Sub-Accounts shall be determined in accordance with the following schedule: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding
the foregoing, if a Participant is employed by an Employer or a Related Company on his Normal Retirement Date, the date he becomes Disabled, or the date he dies, his
vested interest in his Regular and Additional Discretionary Matching Contributions Sub-Accounts shall be 100&nbsp;percent. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.10&nbsp;Election of Former Vesting Schedule  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Sponsor adopts an amendment to the Plan that directly or indirectly affects the computation of a Participant's vested interest in his Employer
Contributions Sub-Account, any Participant with three or more&nbsp;years of Vesting Service shall have a right to have his vested interest in his Employer Contributions
Sub-Account continue to be determined under the vesting provisions in effect prior to the amendment rather than under the new vesting provisions, unless the vested interest of the
Participant in his Employer Contributions Sub-Account under the Plan as amended is not at any time less than such vested interest determined without regard to the amendment. A Participant
shall exercise his right under this Section&nbsp;by giving written notice of his exercise thereof to the Administrator within 60&nbsp;days after the latest of (i)&nbsp;the date he receives
notice of the amendment from the Administrator, (ii)&nbsp;the effective date of the amendment, or (iii)&nbsp;the date the amendment is adopted. Notwithstanding

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=22,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=407791,FOLIO='15',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CI1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ci1606_1_16"> </A>
the foregoing, a Participant's vested interest in his Employer Contributions Sub-Account on the effective date of such an amendment shall not be less than his vested interest in his
Employer Contributions Sub-Account immediately prior to the effective date of the amendment. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>6.11&nbsp;Forfeitures to Reduce Employer Contributions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision of the Plan to the contrary, the amount of the Employer Contribution required under this Article&nbsp;for a Plan Year shall
be reduced by the amount of any forfeitures occurring during the Plan Year or any prior Plan Year that are not used to pay Plan expenses and that are applied against Employer Contributions as provided
in Article&nbsp;XIV. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE VII<BR>
LIMITATIONS ON CONTRIBUTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>7.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of this Article, the following terms have the following meanings: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>aggregate limit</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the sum of (i)&nbsp;125&nbsp;percent of the greater of the average "contribution percentage" for "eligible
participants" other than Highly Compensated Employees or the average
"deferral percentage" for Eligible Employees other than Highly Compensated Employees and (ii)&nbsp;the lesser of 200&nbsp;percent or two plus the lesser of such average "contribution percentage"
or average "deferral percentage", or, if it would result in a larger "aggregate limit", the sum of (iii)&nbsp;125&nbsp;percent of the lesser of the average "contribution percentage" for "eligible
participants" other than Highly Compensated Employees or the average "deferral percentage" for Eligible Employees other than Highly Compensated Employees and (iv)&nbsp;the lesser of
200&nbsp;percent or two plus the greater of such average "contribution percentage" or average "deferral percentage". For purposes of determining the "aggregate limit", the "contribution percentages"
and "deferral percentages" used shall be for the applicable "testing year". </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>annual addition</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" with respect to a Participant for a "limitation year" means the sum of the Tax-Deferred Contributions
and Employer Contributions allocated to his Account for the "limitation year" (including any "excess contributions" that are distributed pursuant to this Article), the employer contributions,
"employee contributions", and forfeitures allocated to his accounts for the "limitation year" under any other qualified defined contribution plan (whether or not terminated) maintained by an Employer
or a Related Company concurrently with the Plan, and amounts described in Code Sections 415(l)(2)&nbsp;and 419A(d)(2)&nbsp;allocated to his account for the "limitation year". </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>contribution percentage</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" with respect to an "eligible participant" for a particular Plan Year means the ratio of the Matching
Contributions made to the Plan on his behalf for the Plan Year to his "test compensation" for such Plan Year. To the extent permitted by regulations issued under Code Section&nbsp;401(m), the
Sponsor may elect to include the Tax-Deferred Contributions and/or Qualified Nonelective Contributions made to the Plan on an "eligible participant's" behalf for the Plan Year in computing
the numerator of such "eligible participant's" "contribution percentage". Notwithstanding the foregoing, any Tax-Deferred Contributions and/or Qualified Nonelective Contributions that are
included in determining the numerator of an "eligible participant's" "deferral percentage" may not be included in determining the numerator of his "contribution percentage". </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributions
made on an "eligible participant's" behalf for a Plan Year shall be included in determining his "contribution percentage" for such Plan Year only if the contributions are
allocated to the "eligible participant's" Account as of a date within such Plan Year and are made to the Plan before the end of the 12-month period immediately following the Plan Year to
which the contributions relate. The determination of an "eligible participant's" "contribution percentage" shall be made after any
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=23,EFW="2133328",CP="THE SPORTS AUTHORITY, INC.",DN="3",CHK=292986,FOLIO='16',FILE='DISK020:[04DEN6.04DEN1606]CI1606A.;3',USER='BSKELLE',CD='15-APR-2004;00:56' -->
<A NAME="page_ci1606_1_17"> </A>
reduction required to satisfy the Code Section&nbsp;415 limitations is made as provided in this Article&nbsp;VII and shall satisfy such other requirements as may be prescribed by the Secretary of
the Treasury. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>deferral percentage</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" with respect to an Eligible Employee for a particular Plan Year means the ratio of the Tax-Deferred
Contributions made on his behalf for the Plan Year to his "test compensation" for the Plan Year. To the extent permitted by regulations issued under Code
Section&nbsp;401(k), the Sponsor may elect to include Qualified Nonelective Contributions made to the Plan on the Eligible Employee's behalf for the Plan Year in computing the numerator of such
Eligible Employee's "deferral percentage". Notwithstanding the foregoing, any Tax-Deferred Contributions and/or Qualified Nonelective Contributions that are included in determining the
numerator of an Eligible Employee's "contribution percentage" may not be included in determining the numerator of his "deferral percentage". </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributions
